greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table read by rows: the n-th row is the list of numbers diagonally up and to the right of n in the natural numbers read by antidiagonals.
link: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Table[Reverse@ Range[SelectFirst[Reverse@ #, # < n &] + 1, n - 1] - 1, {n, 2, 35}] &[Accumulate@ Range[0, 15] + 1] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jun 10 2016, Version 10 *)
results.author: _Peter Kagey_, Jun 09 2016
